Text saved: Carol Dweck is a person who studies how people think. She talks about an idea called a "growth mindset". A growth mindset is a way of thinking. It means you believe you can learn and get better. She says our brains can change. We can learn new things, even if we are not good at them at first.

Many of us say good things about the final result. Or we say good things about natural talents. For example, we say "You are very good with details." Or "You are very good at planning things."

But studies show there is a better way. We should talk about how people do something. We should say good things when they try hard. We should also praise them when they try new ways to find answers. This helps people learn new skills. And it helps them get better at their talents.
